key_title: Key to the species of Pycnosorus

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves oblanceolate, green, sparsely hirsute; compound heads 1-several; bracts of common involucre small, linear to elliptic; plant annual; north-west only
Leaves linear to linear-lanceolate, woolly at least on lower surface (often becoming sparsely woolly with age); compound heads solitary; bracts of common involucre absent; plant annual or perennial

Leaves mostly 1.5–10 cm long, usually discolorous, 1-veined (sometimes with 2 faint secondary veins); capitular bracts without scarious margins except rarely at base, lamina glandular, woolly at base; plant usually annual
Leaves mostly 10–30 cm long, concolorous, 3 (–8)-veined; capitular bract with a golden scarious tip and narrow scarious margins towards base, lamina woolly; plant usually perennial
